>From the Heritrix FAQ:


How do I run Heritrix on windows.
        Before you begin, Heritrix is not supported on windows -- See
        requirements -- mostly because we don't have the resources to
        support any more than the linux platform we use internally at
        the Internet Archive. That said, a CMD script has been added to
        $HERITRIX_HOME/bin lately that does most of what the
        $HERITRIX_HOME/bin/heritrix does loading jars in the right
        order, etc. (Originally contributed by Eric Jensen and finished
        by Max Sch√∂fmann). Max has also written up this page: Web
        crawling: Using Heritrix on Windows. Also see Crawler Stalling
        on Windows, 2085 and the items below that pertain to windows:
        dns and mkdir.
        
You should probably look to heritrix.cmd for guidance on classpath
issues & jar loading order.

Or, install Linux :-)

Ted

On Fri, 2007-08-24 at 13:28 -0400, mikej wrote:
> Any help with the below issue would be greatly appreciated!
> 
> Mike
> 
> 
> 
> On 8/23/07, mikej <bosoxchamps@...> wrote:
>         Thanks for the help so far, but I am hitting the following
>         issue:
>         
>         First - I confirmed that the lib jar files are visible by
>         checking the following:
>         Right click on project --> select Properties --> highligh
>         'Java Build Path' --> Select 'Libraries' tab. All jars appear
>         to configured for the environment. At one point I did have to
>         'Edit...' the location of the jars to point to proper version
>         of the jar. That all seems to be taken care of. 
>         
>         1) I opened the 'src/java' tree and then opened the
>         'org.archive.crawler' tree
>         2) I right clicked on the 'Heritrix.java' and select 'Debug
>         As' --> Java Application
>         
>         I get the following error immediately in the Eclipse Console
>         window - 
>         "<terminated> Heritrix [Java Application] C:\Program Files
>         \Java\jre1.5.0_10\bin\javaw.exe (Aug 23, 2007 5:41:04 PM)"
>         
>         Mike
>         
>         
>         On 8/23/07, Paul Jack <pjack@...> wrote:
>                 > Is there more specific documentation that helps out
>                 a more novice
>                 > developer like myself?
>                 
>                 There's the developer's guide:
>                 http://crawler.archive.org/articles/developer_manual/building.html#eclipse
>                 
>                 > Any help would be greatly appreciated,
>                 
>                 You'll need to copy the /lib directory jar files to
>                 a /lib directory in 
>                 your Eclipse project. Otherwise it sounds like you
>                 should be ready to 
>                 go. To run Heritrix in Eclipse, right-click the 
>                 org.archive.crawler.Heritrix class and select "Debug
>                 As/Java Application."
>                 
>                 -Paul
>                 
>                 
>                 
>         
>
